___level.description: The GZip compression method used on a table.

___skipLineCount.description: The number of lines/rows to be skipped when parsing text files. The default value is 0.

___firstRowAsHeader.description: When used as input, treat the first row of data as headers. When used as output, write the headers into the output as the first row of data. The default value is false.

___treatEmptyAsNull.description: Treat empty column values in the text file as null. The default value is true.

___encodingName.description: The code page name of the preferred encoding. If miss, the default value is “utf-8”, unless BOM denotes another Unicode encoding. Refer to the “Name” column of the table in the following link to set supported values: https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.text.encoding.aspx.

___anchorDateTime.description: The date used as a reference point for calculating slice start and end dates.

___interval.description: The interval of running the scheduler.

___frequency.description: Frequency in terms of minute, hour, day, etc.

___offset.description: The offset relative to the anchor time.

___external.description: If set to true, the table is an external data set.

___structure.description: Columns that define the structure of the table.

$eref.description: The format definition of a storage.
$eref.title: Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories.Models.StorageFormat

___skipLineCount.description: The number of lines/rows to be skipped when parsing text files. The default value is 0.

___firstRowAsHeader.description: When used as input, treat the first row of data as headers. When used as output, write the headers into the output as the first row of data. The default value is false.

___treatEmptyAsNull.description: Treat empty column values in the text file as null. The default value is true.

___encodingName.description: The code page name of the preferred encoding. If miss, the default value is “utf-8”, unless BOM denotes another Unicode encoding. Refer to the “Name” column of the table in the following link to set supported values: https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.text.encoding.aspx.

$eref.description: The data stored in JSON format.
$eref.title: Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories.Models.JsonFormat

___nestingSeparator.description: The character used to separate nesting levels. Default value is '.' (dot).

___jsonNodeReference.description: The JSONPath of the JSON array element to be flattened. Reference: http://goessner.net/articles/JsonPath/.

___filePattern.description: File pattern of JSON. To be more specific, the way of separating a collection of JSON objects. The default value is 'setOfObjects'. It is case-sensitive.

___encodingName.description: The code page name of the preferred encoding. If not provided, the default value is 'utf-8', unless the byte order mark (BOM) denotes another Unicode encoding. The full list of supported values can be found in the 'Name' column of the table of encodings in the following reference: https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.text.encoding.aspx#Anchor_5.

___jsonPathDefinition.description: The definition of the relative JSONPath in the original JSON objects for the targeted column in the converted row when converting JSON objects to rows. Example: { "Column1": "$.Column1Path"}. The JSONPath of the root items must start with a "$" character and all the other items in the flattened array defined by JsonNodeReference must not.

___typeProperties.description: Properties specific to this table type.

___tableName.description: The table name of the Azure SQL database.

_88dataElement.description: Data element defines the semantics of each column of a table.
_88dataElement.title: Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories.Models.DataElement

___retryTimeout.description: Specifies the timeout for the activity to run. If there is value specified, it takes the value of TimeSpan.FromMilliseconds(-1) which means indefinite timeout.

___validationPriorityOrder.description: Validation priority order.  Choose from OldestFirst or NewestFirst.

_88jsonFormat.description: The data stored in JSON format.
_88jsonFormat.title: Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories.Models.JsonFormat

___nestingSeparator.description: The character used to separate nesting levels. Default value is '.' (dot).

___jsonNodeReference.description: The JSONPath of the JSON array element to be flattened. Reference: http://goessner.net/articles/JsonPath/.

$eref.description: JSON format file pattern. A property of JsonFormat
$eref.title: Microsoft.Azure.Management.DataFactories.Models.JsonFormatFilePattern

___filePattern.description: File pattern of JSON. To be more specific, the way of separating a collection of JSON objects. The default value is 'setOfObjects'. It is case-sensitive.

___encodingName.description: The code page name of the preferred encoding. If not provided, the default value is 'utf-8', unless the byte order mark (BOM) denotes another Unicode encoding. The full list of supported values can be found in the 'Name' column of the table of encodings in the following reference: https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.text.encoding.aspx#Anchor_5.

___jsonPathDefinition.description: The definition of the relative JSONPath in the original JSON objects for the targeted column in the converted row when converting JSON objects to rows. Example: { "Column1": "$.Column1Path"}. The JSONPath of the root items must start with a "$" character and all the other items in the flattened array defined by JsonNodeReference must not.
